episode_title: 418 - The One With Rachel’s New Dress

content.description: Central Perk, Joey and Chandler are there as Phoebe enters carrying a drum.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey! Wow, it is true what they say, pregnant bellies look like a drum.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ha-ha. (She sits down on the couch.) No, it’s just I’m so pregnant that I—my guitar doesn’t fit anymore. So I thought ‘til I’m not, I’m just gonna play all my songs on this drum. It sounds really cool!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Listen. Listen. (She starts to play and sing.) Smelly cat, smelly cat, what are they feeding you?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow, Pheebs! That sounds great!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know! I know, and I’ve only been playing for like an hour!

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: Phoebe! Phoebe! Hi! Hi!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey! What are you doing here?

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: Umm, actually, I came down to ask you a big favour.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, well, don’t tell me you want to keep more of your stuff in my uterus.

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: No. No. No. (Sits down.) Okay, now, see, I wanna name the girl baby Leslie, and Frank wants to name one of the boy babies Frank JR. JR.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wouldn’t that be Frank the III?

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: Don’t get me started. (To Phoebe) Anyway, umm, since there are three babies and umm, we both got to put our names in, we would be truly honoured if you named the other boy baby.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow! That’s so great! Oh! Oh! Cougar.

content.speaker: Alice
content.text: You think about it. (Leaves)

content.description: Ross’s apartment, he and Emily are getting ready to go to the airport.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: I left a bra drying on the shower rod, you don’t think your son will think it’s yours and be horribly traumatised?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, if mommy can have a wife, daddy can have a bra.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Ohh, it’s time to go.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, no-no-no, see, that-that clock’s a little fast, uh, we have 17 minutes. Huh, what can we do in 17 minutes? Twice?

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Well that’s ambitious.
(They kiss but are interrupted by a knock on the door.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, uh, you can ignore that.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: That’s Carol with your son!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uhh, believe me when he’s older, he’ll understand.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Ross!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’ll be right there. (He goes over and opens the door to Carol, Susan, and Ben.) (To Ben.) Hello! (To Carol.) Hello! (To Susan.) Hey. Uhh, Emily, this is Carol and Susan.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Hey, it’s so nice to finally meet you!

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Me too!

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Ohh, y’know, Susan’s gonna be shooting a commercial in London next week.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Oh yeah, I’m so excited, I’ve never been there.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Oh, well, I’ll show you around.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: That would be great! Also, uh, I was hoping to catch a show so if you can make any suggestions…

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Oh, there’s tonnes of terrific stuff—I’ll go with you!

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Ahh!
(Ross accidentally, on purpose, bumps into Susan.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look at you two, bonding, making us late for the airport so…

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Are you all right?

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Oh, he’s fine. He’s fine. It’s just that us getting along is difficult for him, because he doesn’t like me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh come on! That’s-that’s… true.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s erm, Chandler and Joey’s, Joey and Chandler are playing foosball as Phoebe enters.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey! Do we have a baby name yet?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ugh! No! This is so hard! I went through this whole book (Holds up a book) and found nothing! I want a name that’s really like, y’know strong and confident, y’know? Like-like Exxon.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, it certainly worked for that Valdez kid.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ooh-ooh, Pheebs, you want a strong name? How about, The Hulk?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, I’m-I’m not sure about Hulk, but I like the idea of a name starting with “The.”

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, want a good name, go with Joey. Joey’s your pal. Joey’s your buddy. “Where is everybody?” “Well, they’re hanging out with Joey.”

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, y’know what, if you’re gonna do that, if you’re gonna name him Joey, you should name him Chandler. (Phoebe doesn’t think so.) Oh, come on! Chandler’s funny, sophisticated, and he’s very loveable, once you get to know him.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh well, hey, Joey’s loveable too! But the thing about Joey is, if you need him, he’ll be there.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, Chandler will be there for you too. I mean, well, he might be a little late, but-but, he’ll be there. And he’ll bring you some cold soda, if want you need him for is that you’re really hot.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What do ya say? What do ya say?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I, I like the idea of naming him after someone I love, and Joey and Chandler are great names. (They both stare at her.) But, all right, I don’t—maybe I’ll just name him The Hulk.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I knew I shouldn’t have mentioned it! That’s what I wanted to name my kid!

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s erm, Monica and Rachel’s, Monica is cooking and Rachel is getting ready for a date with Joshua.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, Mon, if you were hoping to sleep with Joshua the first time tonight, which one of these would you want to be wearing. (She’s holding two frilly, lace nighties.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know what? It really creeps me out choosing other people’s sex clothes.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Sorry. I’m so exited! I’ve been waiting for this for months! I got my hair coloured! I got new sheets! I’m making him a very fancy meal.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Um-hmm.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What am I making him by the way?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, you’re making him a frieze salad with goat cheese and pine nuts, wild nuts, wild rice, roast asparagus, and salmon au croup.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I thought I was making him filet mignon?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, you were, but you decided to make salmon because you had some left over at the restaurant. And then you realised if you (Points at Rachel) bitched about it, then you (Points to herself) would stop cooking, and you (Points at Rachel) would have to make your famous baked potato and Diet Coke.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow, I really get crabby when I cook.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s erm, Chandler and Joey’s, Joey, Chandler, and Phoebe are there as Ross enters.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So uh, Emily called last night…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And now you’re giving me the message!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Turns out them Emily is just crazy about Susan. Yeah, they’re going to the theatre together! They’re going to dinner! They’re going horseback riding!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: God, Susan is so fun!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, this is just a little too familiar, okay? For like, for like six months before Carol and I spilt up, all I heard was: “My friend Susan is so smart. My friend Susan is so funny. My friend Susan is so great.”

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You actually think that something can happen between Emily and Susan?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, they’re going to the gym together! Two women! Stretching! Y’know they-they take a steam together! Things get a little playful—didn’t you see Personal Best ?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, but I’m gonna!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi! Hi! You’re crazy! Okay? This is Emily. Emily is straight.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How do you know? I mean we thought Carol was straight before I married her!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I definitely. I don’t like the name Ross.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What a weird way to kick me when I’m down.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No! No! I-I meant for the baby!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh. What’s wrong with Ross?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, it’s just y’know that something like this would never to like The Hulk, y’know…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Actually that-that’s not true, in The Incredible Hulk uh, No. 72, Dr. Bruce Banner found… (Sees everyone staring at him and stops.) Y’know, ugh, nevermind, my girlfriend’s a lesbian. (Leaves.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So, I decided I’m definitely going to go with either Joey or Chandler.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh! Oh-oh, you gotta pick Joey! I mean, name one famous person named Chandler.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Raymond Chandler.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Someone you didn’t make up!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, there are no famous Joey’s. Except for, huh, Joey Buttafucco.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, that guy really hurt us.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, how about a compromise then, okay? What if it’s like y’know, Chanoey?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, look, Joey! Come on, think about it, first of all, he’ll never be President. There’s never gonna be a President Joey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right look man, I didn’t want to bring this up, but Chandler, is the stupidest name I ever heard in my life! It’s not even a name; it’s barely even a word. Okay? It’s kinda like chandelier, but it’s not! All right? It’s a stupid, stupid non -name!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wow, you’re, you’re right. I have a horrible, horrible name.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m sorry man, I didn’t—I’m-I’m sorry. I’m sorry. (Goes over and comforts him.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So I guess it’s Joey then!

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s erm, Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel is on her dinner date with Joshua.

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: This is so nice. Thank you for doing this.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, please! Cooking soothes me. (They kiss.) Ahh. So, dig in!

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Great! Oh, it all looks sooo good!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hmmm!

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh I know, my God, this is so—this rice is so—I am so good.

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Behind you?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, yeah, I’m sorry. They used to live here; sometimes they migrate back over.
content.parenthetical: sees the chick and the duck

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Is there ah, is there some way they can not be here. It’s just ah, farm birds really kinda freak me out!
content.parenthetical: getting up and backing away from they.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, sure, okay. Okay.
(Rachel gets up and ushers them into the hall, as they pass Joshua, he leaps onto the counter to avoid them. Rachel drops them off in the hall, and knocks on Joey’s door.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, how did you do that?! Come on in. (He brings them inside.)
[Cut back to Rachel’s date.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All gone! So, farm birds, huh?

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Yeah, it’s-it’s my only weird thing, I swear. And I-I-I would’ve told you about it, but I didn’t know they would be here.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: So, all right.
(They both sit back down.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. So, can I serve you a little of—What? What? What? (She sees that Joshua isn’t relaxed.)

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Nothing I uh, it’s just that I know that they’re still out there.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But, they’re across the hall! I mean that’s two doors away, it would take them a long time to peck their way back over here.

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Okay, that’s-that’s not funny. Uhh.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, y’know, would you feel better if we went someplace else? I mean we could pack all this stuff up and y’know go to your apartment.

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Oh, they’re working on this week, it’s a total mess. But uh, I’m staying at my parents’ house, we could go there.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Your parents’?

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Yeah, they’re out of town.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh.

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Yeah-yeah, it’s this huge place, and-and it’s got this gorgeous view of the park, and very, very romantic. What do you say?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah that works.
(He moves to kiss her, but stops when he hears the duck.)

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: They-they-they can smell fear.

content.description: Ross’s apartment, Carol has come to pick up Ben.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Hey! How’s Ben?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I asked him if he wanted to eat, he said, “No.” I asked him if he wanted to sleep, he said, “No.” I asked him what he wanted to do, he said, “No.” So, he’s sweeping. (We see Ben playing with a broom and a dustpan.)

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Hey, Ben! Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So umm, any word from Susan?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Ooh, yeah! She said she’s having sooo much fun with Emily.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh-huh. Uh-huh. Uh, by the by, did it uh, did it ever occur to you that, I don’t know, maybe they might be having a little too much fun?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: What’s too much fun?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know, the kind of fun, you and Susan had when we were married.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Oh my God, you are so paranoid!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Am I?!

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Am I ?!

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: I can’t speak for Emily, but Susan is in a loving, committed relationship.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh-huh, Carol, so were we. All right, just-just imagine for a moment, Susan meets someone and-and they really hit it off. Y’know? Say-say they’re coming back from the theatre, and they-they stop at a pub for a couple of drinks, they’re laughing, y’know, someone innocently touches someone else… There’s electricity, it’s new. It’s exciting. Are you telling me there isn’t even the slightest possibility of something happening?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Maybe.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: OH MY GOD!! I didn’t really believe it until you just said it!!

content.description: Joshua’s parents’ apartment, Rachel and Joshua are entering.

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: …and even though none of the other kids believed me, I swear to God, that duck pushed me!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow! This place is fabulous!

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Yeah, yeah, let me show you around. This is the uh, downstairs living room.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Whoa-whoa, there’s two living rooms? God, growing up here, this place must’ve been a real babe magnet.

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Yeah, well, it would’ve been, but uh, my parents just moved here.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, you should know, this place is a real babe magnet. Wanna make out?
(They kiss.)

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Hey, here’s an idea. Why don’t uh, I put the food in the fridge and we can eat it later?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That sounds like a plan. Umm, is there a place I can go freshen up?

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Oh yeah, yeah uh, it’s down the hall and uh, second door to your left.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ah.
(She goes down the hall. Joshua goes to put the food away when his parents walk in.)

content.speaker: Mrs. Burgin
content.text: Oh, hi, darling!

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Mom, Dad, what are you guys doing here?

content.speaker: Mrs. Burgin
content.text: Oh, well we cut the trip short.

content.speaker: Mr. Burgin
content.text: France sucks!

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Umm, this may be a little weird, but I-I-I got a date here.

content.speaker: Mrs. Burgin
content.text: Oh, say no more!

content.speaker: Mr. Burgin
content.text: We’ll just grab some food and take it with us right upstairs, and we’ll be right out of you hair.

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Oh, that-that would be great. So you didn’t even get to Italy?

content.speaker: Mr. Burgin
content.text: Yep, sucks!

(They all go into the kitchen. Just then, Rachel comes back from the bathroom; she had removed her dress and is wearing nothing but a lace nightie. She tries to find someplace seductive to wait for Joshua. She tries to sit on the piano, but it makes too much noise. So she goes over to the couch and kinda half lays down to wait for Joshua. Joshua comes in from the kitchen, sees Rachel, and freezes.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi you!

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know, I can do more than cook.
(Just then, his parents enter. Rachel gasps.)

content.speaker: Mr. Burgin
content.text: I like her. She sees smart.

content.description: Joshua’s parents’ apartment, continued from earlier.

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: Uhh, Rachel, my parents…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh! It’s so nice to meet you. (She goes over and shakes their hands.) Hello.

content.speaker: Mr. Burgin
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hello.

content.speaker: Mrs. Burgin
content.text: Hello. Well, Joshua, that $500 was for groceries.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? This-this, no, oh no, no-no-no, this is not—that’s-that’s not what it is. See, see, okay, I work in fashion, see and-and, this is a real dress actually. It’s-it’s, they’re-they’re wearing it in Milan, so part of my job is too wear the clothes, and then I see how people respond, and then I report back to my superiors at Bloomingdale’s , so… And obviously in uh, in-in this case, (She grabs a pen and paper) I am going to report back, “USA not ready.”

content.speaker: Mrs. Burgin
content.text: Maybe in L.A?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Joshua
content.text: There you go.

content.speaker: Mr. Burgin
content.text: So, have you kids eaten yet?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, we were going to do that after—I mean umm, next.

content.speaker: Mr. Burgin
content.text: Well, we’re starving, why don’t we all go get something to eat?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, yeah, well… Yeah, no use wasting this baby, just lyin’ around the house.

content.speaker: Mr. Burgin
content.text: So… We go eat.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Mr. Burgin
content.text: You’ll wear that. We’ll be eating, and of course, you’ll be wearing that.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s erm, Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler is looking for a new name in Phoebe’s book of names.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dude, I am sorry about what I said!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, no, you’re right, it is a ridiculous name!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s not that bad.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes it is! From now on, I have no first name.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So, you’re just Bing?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I have no name.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, so, what are we supposed to call you?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay uh, for now, temporarily, you can call me, Clint.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No way are you cool enough to pull of Clint.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, so what name am I cool enough to pull off?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, Gene.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s Clint. It’s Clint! (He heads for his bedroom.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: See you later, Gene.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Bye, Gene.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s Clint! Clint !

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What’s up with Gene?

content.description: Central Perk, Rachel is telling Phoebe and Monica of her date.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So, you wore your nightie to dinner?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, yeah. And uh, the best part though, when the uh, waiter spilled water down my back, I jumped up, and my boob popped out.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, no!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, it’s all right. I got nice boobs. (Phoebe and Monica nod there heads in agreement.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So, I just picked up a message from Emily, she and Susan are going to a poetry reading together!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So! Poetry? Susan’s gay! They’re being gay together!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Emily’s straight.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, wake up!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow, Carol really messed you up!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Excuse me?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, she turned you into this-this-this untrusting, crazy, jealous, sycophant. (They all look at her.) All right, so I don’t know what sycophant means, but the rest is right.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, I don’t know what you’re talking about, I am not a crazy, jealous person.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Huh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: She’s totally right! When we were together, you got all freaked out about Mark and there was nothing going on.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This totally makes sense!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It does not!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, sure it does! In high school, you weren’t jealous at all even though all your girlfriends were cheating on you!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, all right, so up until ‘92-93 he was very trusting, then ’94 hit, Carol left him and bamn! Paranoid city!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Absolutely! Absolutely!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This is so much fun!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: This is not fun!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look, all we’re trying to say is, don’t let what happened with Carol ruin what you got with Emily.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. The ’92 Ross wouldn’t.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I still think I was right about that whole Mark thing.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What—yeah—what, y’know what? I hope Emily is a lesbian.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s erm, Chandler and Joey’s, Phoebe is showing off more of her drum skills to Joey by rubbing one of the sticks back and forth across the drum.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Drum roll.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. Okay. All right. Help! Am I a Mark, or a John?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nah, you’re not tall enough to be a Mark, but you might make a good Barney.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right look, am I serious, okay? Tomorrow at 3:30 I am going down to the courthouse.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You’re actually going through with this?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, look, this name has been holding me back my entire life. Okay, it’s probably why kids picked on me in school, and why I never do well with women… So, as of 4 o’clock tomorrow, I’m either gonna be Mark Johnson or John Markson.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You got problems because of you! Not your name! All right, this has got to stop! Chandler is a great name! In fact—yes, (To Joey) I’m, I’m sorry. I know you really wanted me to name the baby Joey, but eh, so, I’m-I’m, I’m gonna, I’m gonna name the baby Chandler.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, but you have to keep the name too!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. Thanks.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You wanna hug it out?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah!
(They both hug.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yay!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yay!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yay—oh—yay! Okay, I gotta go tell Frank and Alice! Right now!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, uh… (She grabs her coat and runs out.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Bye, Pheebs!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, bye!
(She exits, and after the door is closed, Chandler turns to Joey and…)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ha! Ha! Ha!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ohh! (Realises it was all a trick to get Phoebe to name the baby Chandler.)

content.description: the airport, Carol and Ross are waiting for Emily and Susan to deplane. A gorgeous woman walks by and they both turn to watch her go.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Nice luggage.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: I was gonna say…
(Susan and Emily get off.)

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Hey!
(They both run and hug they’re respective partners.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Hey! I missed you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, I missed you too.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Thanks for everything, I had such a great time.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Oh, so did I.
(They hug and give each other a little peck on the cheek.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No tongue. (And gives her the thumbs up.)
